targetString: WHO ayaa bogaadisay dadaalada masuuliyiinta Shiinaha ee maaraynta iyo xakamaynta safmareenka.
en-mt: WHO has endorsed the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and controlling the epidemic.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: WHO ayaa sheegtay mid kasoo horjeeda intii u dhaxaysay 2002-2004 dilaacitaankii SARS, halkaas oo masuuliyiinta Shiinaha lagu eedeeyay qarinta dib u dhigista dadaalada ka hortaga iyo xakamaynta, iyo musiibada hadda halka dawlada dhexe "ay bixinayso la socodsiin cusub si looga hortago walwal ku yimaada fasaxyada Sanadka Cusub ee Lunar".
en-mt: WHO said it was contrary to the 2002-2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of hiding delays in preventive and containment efforts, and the current disaster while the central government "provides new monitoring to prevent worries about Lunar New Year holidays".

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: 23dii Janaayo, iyagoo ka falcelinaya go'aankii masuuliyiinta dhexe ee ay ku dhaqangelinayeen xayiraada gaadiidka Wuhan, wakiilka WHO Gauden Galea ayaa xusay inaysan ahayn "talo ay bixiyeen WHO", waxay ahayd sidoo kale "astaan aad u muhiim ah ee ka go'naanta inay ku xakameeyaan safmareenka meesha uu aad ugu badanyahay" waxaana ugu magac dareen "filasho la'aanta taariikhda caafimaadka bulshada". 30kii Janaayo, iyadoo dabasocota xaqiijin inuu ukala gudbayo bini'aadanka banaanka Shiinaha iyo koroorka tirada kiisaska dalalka kale, WHO waxay ku dhawaaqday in dilaacitaanku yahay Walaac Caalami ah oo Soo ifbax degdegga ee Caafimaadka Bulshada (PHEIC), PHEIC lixaad ilaa iyo inta talaabada la qaaday intii lagu gudajiray safmareenka 2009 ee hargab doofaarka.
en-mt: On 23 January, reacting to the central authorities' decision to implement the Wuhan traffic ban, WHO representative Gauden Galea noted that it was not "a recommendation by the WHO", it was also a "very important symbol of their determination to control the epidemic where it is most common" and dubbed it "the lack of expectation in the history of public health". On 30 January, following confirmation that it was crossing between the outsiders of China and increasing the number of cases in other countries, WHO declared the outbreak a Global Concern for the Emergence of Rapid Public Health (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC as long as action was taken during the 2009 pandemic of swine fever.

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Agaasimaha Guud ee WHO Tedros Adhanom ayaa sheegay in PHEIC ay u dhaw dahay "khatar ah ku faafitaanka caalamka, gaar ahaan dalalka dakhliga hoose iyo kuwa dhexe ee aan lahayn nidaam caafimaad oo xoogan.
en-mt: WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom said PHEIC is close to "a threat to global spread, especially in low and middle-income countries that do not have a strong health system.

en-mt: In response to the implementation of the immigration restrictions, Tedros said "there is no reason to take measures that do not appropriately interact with international traffic and trade" and that "WHO does not recommend restricting movement and trade".

en-mt: On 5 February, WHO requested a $675 million contribution from the international community to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, highlighting the urgency of supporting those countries "without systems in place to identify people infected with the virus, even if it were to emerge."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Tedros ayaa si dheeri ah u sheegay maqaal ah "waxaan u xooganahay kaliya sida xiriirkeena ugu daciifsan" wuxuuna ugu baaqay bulshada caalamka inay "maanta maalgashadaan ama ay  berri mid ka badan bixiyaan". 11ka Febraayo, WHO oo shir jaraaid qabatay ayaa magaca xanuunka ku sheegtay COVID-1.

en-mt: The UN Disaster Management Team has been deployed as a result, allowing for overall collaboration in the UN reaction, which the WHO says allows it to "focus on clinical reactions while other agencies can deliver the experience to adapt to the wider social, economic and development outcomes of the outbreak".

targetString: 14kii Febraayo, Koox Hawgal oo Iskudhaf ah oo ay hogaaminayso WHO oo la socota Shiinaha ayaa la hawlgaliyay si loo sameeyo inay khubarada caalamiga ah iyo kuwa WHO ee Shiinaha jooga ay u caawiyaan maaraynta maxalli iyo qiimaynta "ba'naanta iyo isu gudbinta cudurka" iyagoo qabanaya siminaaro iyo kulamo ay la yeeshaan macaahida ugu muhiimsan ee heer qaran iyo si ay u sameeyaan booqashooyinka goobta si ay u qiimeeyaan "saamaynta hawlaha ka falcelinta ee heer gobol iyo heer ismaamul, oo ay ku jiraan meelaha magaalada iyo baadiyaha". 25tii Febraayo, WHO ayaa ku dhawaaqday in "caalamku sameeyo wax badan si uu isugu diyaaro cudur caalami oo suurtagal ah ee coronavirus," iyagoo sheegaya inkastoo ay xilli hore tahay in lagu magacaabo cudur caalami ah, dalalku waa inay marwalba ay ahaadaan "waji diyaarsanaan".
en-mt: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Task Force with China was deployed to make it to assist international and WHO experts in China in local management and assess the "severity and transmission of the disease" by holding workshops and meetings with the main national institutes and to conduct on-site visits to assess the "impact of reactionary activities at the regional level. and at a level of autonomy, including in the areas of the city and the countryside". On 25 February, who announced that "the international community is doing more to prepare itself for a possible global pandemic of the coronavirus," saying although it is too early to be called a global pandemic, countries must always be "prepared."

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.

en-mt: The statistics of the study concluded that these countries conducted a large number of tests, and at that time the number of adults who died, was then smaller in number of deaths, which may have led to better detection when there were few or no symptoms even.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: WHO waxay ku talinyaa in dalalka aan lahayn awooda shaybaadh iyo shaybaadho qaran oo markaa khibradoodu xadidan yahay COVID-19 inay u diraan inta ugu horeysa ee laga helo uyo tobanka ugu horeey ee laga waayo COVID-19 muunadaha mid kamid ah 16 shaybaadh ee WHO si ay u xaqiijiyaan shaybaadhada.
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries with no national laboratory and laboratory capacity and then limited experience of COVID-19 send the first of the first ten samples from covid-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO laboratories to confirm the samples.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: Shaybaadh 16ka ah, 7 kamid ah ayaa ku yaala Aasiya, 5 waa Yurub, 2 Afrika, 1 Waqooyiga Maraykanak iyo 1 Austaraaliya ah.
en-mt: Of the 16 laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: Shaxda soo socotaa, qaybta "Laga heley ee % ee shaybaadada" waxaa markaa muquuniyay xeerka shaybaadhka dalka.
en-mt: In the following table, the "Found % of samples" section is then edited by the country's laboratory code.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: Dalka kaliya baadha dadka la dhigaqy isbitaalka waxa laga heleyaa % badan oo shaybaadhka dalka baadhay dhamaan dadkiisa, hadii ay leeyihiin calaamado iyo hadii kaleba, marka laga tago inay waxa iskaga mid noqonayaan.
en-mt: In the country, only people who are hospitalized are found to be the same in the country, whether they have symptoms or not, except that they will be the same.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: Gacmo maydhiga (ama gacmomaydhiga), oo sidoo kale loo yaqaano nadiifinta gacmaha, waxaa weeye sharci uu qofku ku nadiifinayo gacmiisa si uu markaa uga nadiifiyo ciida, saliid ijiinta, cayayaanka, iyo wixii kale ee wasakh ah.
en-mt: Hand washing (or hand washing), also known as hand sanitizing, is a law in which a person cleans his hands to then cleanse it from dust, oil, insects, and other dirt.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: Gacmo dhaqista (ama gacmomayrka), oo sidoo kale loo yaqaano nadiifinta gacmaha, waxaa weeye sharci uu qofku ku nadiifinayo gacmiisa si uu markaa uga nadiifiyo ciida, dufanka, cayayaanka, ama walxaha kale ee aan loo baahnayn.
en-mt: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand sanitizing, is a law in which a person cleans their hands to then clean them from soil, grease, insects, or other unwanted substances.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: In gacmaha lagu maydho sabuun si joogto ahi runtii "wakhtiyadan adag" maalintii waxa ay kahortagtaa faafitaanka xanuuno badan, tusaale ahaan shubanka iyo kolooraha, kaas oo markaa lagu kala qaado candhuufta.
en-mt: Washing hands with soap regularly in fact in these "difficult times" of the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhea and cholera, which is then transmitted through saliva.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: Dadku waxa ay sido kale qaadi karaan cudurada neefsashada sida hargabka ama durayga, tusaale ahaan, hadii ayna mayrin gacmahooda oo ay kadibna taabtaan indhahooda, sanka ama afka (sida, dheecaanka).
en-mt: People can also get respiratory diseases such as colds or injections, for example, if they do not wash their hands and then touch their eyes, nose or mouth (such as, fluids).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Shan mar oo xasaasi ah maalintii oo ay markaa in gacmaha lagu mayrto saabuuntu ay muhiim tahay: kahor iyo kadib marka wax la nadiifiyo, kadib marka ilmaha dabada laga mayro ama laga badalo xafaayada, ka hor inta aadan quudin cunnuga, kahor cunnada iyo ka hor diyaarinta cuntada ama qabashada hilibka ceyriinka ah, kalluunka, ama digaagga.
en-mt: Five sensitive occasions a day when washing hands with soap is important: before and after cleaning something, after the baby's tail is rinsed or replaced by diapers, before feeding the baby, before eating and before preparing food or catching raw meat, fish, or poultry.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: Hadii aanad haysan sabuun iyo biyo, gacmaha waa lagu nadiifin karaa dambas.Hay'ada Caafimaadka Adduunka waxay nagula talinaysaa gacmo dhaqidda:
en-mt: If you don't have soap and water, your hands can be cleaned with ash. The World Health Organization advises us on hand washing:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: Kahor, inta lagu jiro, iyo kadib diyaarinta cuntada.
en-mt: Before, during, and after meal preparation.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: Kahor iyo kadib marka loo adeego qof xanuunsanaya.
en-mt: Before and after when serving a sick person.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: Kadib marka laga badalo xafaada ama loo maydho ilmo suuliga isticmaalay.
en-mt: After changing the diaper or washing the toilet with a child who used the thumb.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Ka dib markaad buufiso sankaaga, qufacdo ama hindhisto.
en-mt: After spraying your nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Ka dib taabashada xayawaanka, quudinta xayawaanka, ama qashinka xoolaha.
en-mt: After touching animals, feeding pets, or animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: Nadaafadda gacanta ee caafimaadka waxaa loola jeedaa dhaqamada nadaafadda ee la xiriira nidaamyada caafimaadka.
en-mt: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices associated with health systems.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: Gacmo maydhista kahor inta aan la bixin dawo ama daryeelka caafimaadku waxa uu kahortagaa ama yareeyaa faafitaanka xanuunada.
en-mt: Hand washing before providing medication or health care prevents or reduces the spread of diseases.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: Ujeedada caafimaad ee ugu weyn ee dhaqitaanka gacmaha waa in laga nadiifiyo gacmaha caabuqyada (bakteeriyada, fayraska, ama cayayaan kale ee keeni kara xanuun) iyo kiimikooyin sababi kara waxyeelo ama cuduro.
en-mt: The main clinical purpose of hand washing is to clear the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other insects that can cause pain) and chemicals that can cause side effects or diseases.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Tani waxa ay si gaar ah muhiim u tahay dadka cuntada ka shaqeeya ama dadka caafimaadka ka shaqeeya, laakiin waxa sidoo kale ay muhiim u tahay shacabka guud ahaan.
en-mt: This is especially important for people who work in food or for people working in health, but it is also important for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: Gacmo maydhigu waxa uu leeyahay faa'idooyin badan oo caafimaad, oo ay ku jiraan yaraynta faafitaanka hargabka, coronavirus, iyo xanuuna kale; waxa uu baajiyaa caabuqa keena shubanka; caabuqa xanuunada neefsiga;
en-mt: Hand washing has many health benefits, including reducing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other diseases; it prevents infections that cause diarrhea; respiratory illnesses infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: oo waxa uu yareetaa xadiga dhimashada ee caruurta guriga lagu dhalo.
en-mt: and reduces the death toll of children born at home.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: Daraasad la sameeyay 2013 ayaa muujinaysa in hormarka lagu sameeyo nidaamka gacmo maydhigu uu horseedi karo in hormar lagu sameeyo mudada koriinka ilmaha ee markaa ka yar shan jirka.
en-mt: A 2013 study shows that progress in the hand washing system can lead to improvements in the development of a child's development period under the age of five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Dalalka soo koraya, xadiga dhimashada caruurta ee markaa la xidhiidha mushkiladaha neefsiga iyo xanuunada shubanka waxaa lagu yarayn karaa isaga oo kaliya la badalo habdhaqanka, sida gacmaha oo sabuun lagu maydho.
en-mt: In developing countries, child mortality rate that is then associated with respiratory problems and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by just changing behavior, such as washing hands with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Talaabadan fudud waxa ay yarayn kartaa xadiga dhimashada ee xanuunadan ilaa 50%.
en-mt: This simple step can reduce the death toll from these diseases by up to 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Ololaha samaynaya wacyi gelinta gacmo maydhigu waxa uu yarayn karaa inuu yimaado shuban ilaa sadex meelood oo meel, oo taas waxa u dhigma biyaha nadiifta ah ee lasiiyo aaga dadka dakhligoodu hooseeyo.
en-mt: Hand washing awareness campaigns can reduce diarrhea by up to a third, which is equivalent to clean water in low-income areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: Yaraynta 48% shubanku waxa uu la xidhiidhaa gacmaha oo lagu maydho saabuun. Gacmaha oo lagu maydho saabuun waxa uu noqon karaa shayga ugu muhiimsan ee uguna jaban ee looga hotagi karo shubanka iyo caabuqa aadka u aran ee neefsiga (ARI), taas oo markaa ah shay si toos ah loogu samayn karo guriga, dugsiyada, iyo bulshada oo dhan.
en-mt: The reduction of 48% of diarrhea is associated with washing hands with soap. Hand washing with soap can be the most important and cheapest way to prevent diarrhea and highly pathogenic respiratory syndrome (ARI), which is then an item that can be made directly at home, in schools, and throughout the community.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Xanuunka sanbabka, ARI aad u wayn, waxaa weeye waxa ugu horreya ee keena dhimashada caruurta ka yar shan sano jirka, kaas oo markaa dila qiyaastii 1.8 milyan oo caruur ah sanadkii.
en-mt: Lung disease, a very large ARI, is the first thing that causes the death of children under the age of five, which then kills about 1.8 million children a year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: Shubanka iyo xanuunka sanbabka marka la isku daro waxa ay sababaan ilaa 3.5 milyan oo caruur ah dhimashadood sanadkii.
en-mt: Diarrhea and lung disease combined cause up to 3.5 million children to die a year.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: Sida ay sheegtey UNICEF, in gacmaha lagu maydho saabuun kahor inta aan cunta da la cunin iyo marka suuliga laga soo baxo oo laga dhigto dhaqan waxa ay badbaadin kartaa nolosha wax ka badan talaal kasta ama daawayn, oo waxa ay baajisaa shubanka kala badh iyo kala badh dhimashada xanuunada neefsiga sadexdii biloodba.
en-mt: According to UNICEF, washing hands with soap before eating food and when the toes are removed from the toilet and making it a practice can save lives more than any vaccine or treatment, eliminating diarrhea by half and half of the deaths from respiratory illness every three months.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: Gacmo maydhiga waxaa caadiyan la dhax galiyaa wacyi gelinta nadaafada ee kale taas oo kamid ah biyaha, nadaafada, iyo nadiifinta barnaamijyada ah (WASH).
en-mt: Hand washing is usually integrated into other hygiene awareness which includes water, sanitation, and cleansing programs (WASH).

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: Gacmo maydhigu waxa ay sidoo kale dadka ka ilaaliyaa caabuqa maqaarka ee markaa taabashada ku gudba.
en-mt: Hand washing also protects people from skin infections that then cross the touch.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Saamayn yar oo xun oo gacmaha maydhiga joogtada ahi waxaa weeye in gacmo maydhiga joogtada ahi ay keeni karaan in maqaarku uu qalalo.
en-mt: A small negative effect of regular hand washing is that regular hand washing can cause the skin to dry.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: Daraasad Denmark lagu sameeyay 2012 ayaa lagu ogaaday in gacmo maydhiga badan uu keeni karo cuncun, inay maqaarku uu yeesho xanuun sida eczema ama cuncun iyo finan, taas oo badanaa lagu yaqaan shaqaalaha daryeelka caafimaadka.
en-mt: A 2012 Danish study found that a lot of hand washing can cause itching, making the skin develop pain such as eczema or itching and acne, which is often known in health care workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: In gacmaha in badan la maydhaa waxaa loo yaqaan calaamadaha lagu yaqaan khalkhalka kaga dhaga qofka wax (OCD).
en-mt: Washing hands more often is known as the symptoms of ocD.

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Waxa jira shan mar oo muhiim ay tahay maalintii in gacmaha lagu maydho saabuuni ay muhiim tahay si markaa loo yareeto in xanuunku qofka afka ka galo:   kadib marka aad suuliga isticmaasho (kaadida, saxarada), kadib marka aad ilmo dabada ka maydho (ka badalka xafaayada), kahor inta aanad quudin ilmaha, kahor inta aanad wax cunin iyo kahor/kadib diyaarinta cuntada ama  ka shaqaynta hilibka, kaluunka, ama digaaga qaydhiin.
en-mt: There are five important occasions during the day that hand washing with soap is important to reduce the pain in the mouth: after using the thumb (urine, stool), after washing a baby's tail (replace the diapers), before feeding the baby, before eating, before eating and before/after preparing food or working on meat,  fish, or chicken.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Marar kale oo marka gacmo maydhiga saxda ah ay tahay in la isticmaalaa waa marka laga hortago faafitaanka xanuunka oo ay ku jirto kahor iyo kadib u daawaynta naburka ama dhaawaca; kadib marka ka hindhiso, qufaco, ama duufka la iska bi'iyo: kadib marka saxarada xayawaan la taabto ama xayawaan laga shaqeeyo; iyo kadib marka qashinka la taabto.
en-mt: Other occasions when proper hand washing should be used are when preventing the spread of the pain including before and after treating the wound or injury; after sneezing, coughing, or vomiting: after touching the feces of an animal or working on an animal; and after the waste has been touched.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Dalal badan, waxaa gacaha ku maydha saabuun dad yar.
en-mt: In many countries, a few people wash their hands with soap.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Daraasad ayaa muujinaysaa in 54 dal 2015 la ogaaday in celcelis ahaan, 38.7% qoysaska ku dhaqma gacmo-dhaqashada saabuunta lagu dhaqo. Daraasad la sameeyay 2014 ayaa muujisay in Sacuudi Carabiya ay heysato saamiga ugu sareeya boqolkiiba 97; Mareykanka oo u dhow dhexe oo leh boqolkiiba 77; iyo Shiinaha oo leh heerka ugu hooseeya ee 23 boqolkiiba. Habab dhowr ah oo dabeecadda ah oo isbeddelka ah ayaa hadda jira si loo kordhiyo qaadashada dhaqanka gacmo-dhaqashada waqtiyada xasaasiga ah. Gacmo-dhaqashada kooxeed ee carruurta dugsiga waqtiyada go'an ee maalinta ayaa ah ikhtiyaar u ah waddamada soo koraya inay gacan ka geystaan dhaqitaanka gacmaha dhaqamada carruurta.
en-mt: One study shows that in 54 countries in 2015 it was found that on average, 38.7% of households practicing soap-washing hand washing. A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia held the highest 97 percent share; The United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with a low of 23 percent. Several behavioral methods of change are now in existence to increase the adoption of the practice of handwashing at sensitive times. Group handwashing of school children at set times of the day is an option for developing countries to help wash hands in children's cultures.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: Barnaamijka Daryeelka Caafimaadka Daruuriga ah oo ay dhaqan gelinayso Waaxda Waxbarashada ee Filibiin waa tusaale misaanka ficilka si markaa loogu horumariyo caafimaadka caruurta iyo waxbarashada.
en-mt: The Cloud Healthcare Program being implemented by the Philippine Department of Education is an example of the scale of action to then improve children's health and education.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Iyada oo la bixinayo laba jeer sanadkii, in lagu daro ku farxalashada saabuunta, ilkaha oo la cadayo oo la findhicisho, ayaa asal u ah barnaamijkamn qaran.
en-mt: By offering twice a year, the addition of soap hand washing, brushing and brushing teeth, is the origin of this national program.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Waxaa sidoo kale si wanaagsan looga dhaqan geliyay Indooniisiya.
en-mt: It was also well implemented in Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: In maqaarka laga baabi'yo cayayaanka waxaa kor u qaada sabuun ama wasakhtire biyo leh.
en-mt: Eliminating insects from the skin is promoted by soap or watery stains.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Talaabada ugu wayn ee sabuunta iyo taydhahu waa in lagu yareeyo caqabadaha xalka, oo kor loogu qaado milankooda.
en-mt: The biggest step in soap and tomatoes is to reduce the obstacles to the solution, and enhance their ingrains.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Biyaha kaliya kuma filna maqaarka in lagu nadiifiyo maadaama oo duxda iyo borootiintu, kuwaas oo qayb ka ah ciida dabiiciga ah, biyaha kuma milmaan.
en-mt: Water is not just enough for the skin to be cleaned as the fats and proteins, which are part of the natural soil, are not soluble in water.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Nadiifinta ayaa, si kastaba ha ahaatee, waxaa caawiya qulqulka biyaha ee macquulka ah.
en-mt: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water.

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Saabuunta adag, maadaama oo dib loo isticmaali karo, waxa saarnaan kara baakteeriyadii kasoo hadhay isticmaalkii hore.
en-mt: The hard soap, since it can be reused, can be on the bacteria that were left in previous use.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Daraasado yar oo lagu eego kasoo gudubka baakteeriyada sabuunta wasakhaysan ayaa oo la sameeyay ayaa muujiyay inay adag tahay in baakteeriyadu ay biyaha ka raacdo.
en-mt: A few studies on the transition from bacteria to polluted soap have shown that it is difficult for bacteria to follow water.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: CDC waxay ku talisaa "in saabuunta dareeraha ah ee gacantu ayna soo gaadhaynin ee markaa weelka kasoo baxdaa ay ka wanaagsan tahay".
en-mt: The CDC recommends that "the liquid soap that the hand does not reach and then the container comes out is better."

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Saabuunta baakhteeriyada disha waaa si wayn loogu xayaysiiyaa si markaa shacabka caafimaadka waxay u tarayso ay u ogaadaan.
en-mt: Antibacterial soaps are widely promoted so that the health public knows what is good.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Ilaa maanta, ma jiraan wax caddeyn ah oo sheegaya in la adeegsado cayayaan dileyaasha ama jeermis dileyaasha lagu taliyaa ee loo doortay cayayaanka antiboodigu aanu waxba ka qaadan inuu dabiici yahay.
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence that the use of recommended insect killers or disinfectants chosen for antibiotic pesticides does not take anything away from being natural.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Si kastaba ha ahaatee, saabuunta bakteeriyada disha waxa ku jira wax bakteeriyada dila caadiyan sida triclosan, kaas oo markaa uu ku jiro wax cayayaanta iska caabiya oo laaya.
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial products such as triclosan, which then contains something that resists and kills.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Marka, xitaa haddii noocyada dawooyinka u adkaysiga antibiyootiga aan loo xushay saabuunta bakteeriyada dila, waxaa laga yaabaa inaysan u noqon wax waxtar ah sidii loo suuqgeeyay.
en-mt: When, even if antibiotic-resistant pharmaceutical strains are not selected for bacterial-killing soaps, they may not be as effective as they have been marketed.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.

A comparable assessment by the University of Oregon Department of Public Health shows that pure soap is as effective as the consumer-designed soap for antibacterial soaps containing triclosan prevention and removal of bacteria from the hands.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Biyaha kulul ee gacantu qaadi kartaa maaha biyaha kulul ee baakteeriyada dilaya.
en-mt: The hot water that the hand can carry is not the hot water that kills bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Taranka bakteeriyada ayaa bata marka heerkulka jirku noqdo (37°C).
en-mt: The proliferation of bacteria is more common when the body temperature is (37°C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Laakiin, biyaha diiranee saabuunta leh waxa ay ka waxtar badan yihiin biyaha qabaw ee saabuunta leh marka la eego maydhisa saliida dabiiciga ah ee markaa ciida iyo baakteeriyada qabata.
en-mt: However, warm and soapy water is more effective than cold and soapy water in terms of washing natural oil that then holds soil and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Si kasoo horjeeda waxa ay dadku aaminsan yahay, daraasad saynisyahano ayaa muujinaysa in isticmaalka biyaha diiran ayna wax saamayn ah ku lahayn yaraynta cayayaanka saaran gacmaha.
en-mt: Contrary to what people believe, a scientists study shows that the use of warm water has no effect on reducing insects on the wrist.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Gacmo nadiifiyaha ama gacmo cayayaan ka dilaha waxaa weeye nadiifiye gacanta oo markaa biyo aan loo isticmaalin.
en-mt: Hand sanitizer or hand-to-hand insect killer is a hand sanitizer that does not use water.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Dhamaadkii 1990-yaadkii iyo horaantii qarnihii 21aad, gacmo nadiifiyaha biya aan loo isticmaalin ee aalkoloda leh (oo sidoo kale loo yaqaanay gacmo lagu jijibiyaha alkohooshe leh, cayayaan ka dilaha gacmaha ee lagu jijibiyo, ama gacmo nadiifiye) ayaa markaa soo caan baxay.
en-mt: By the end of the 1990s and early 21st centuries, alcohol-rich water-free hand sanitizers (also known as alcohol-coated hand-washing, hand-to-hand snails, or hand sanitizers) then became popular.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Badankood waxaa weeye aalkoloda isopropyl ama kuwa ethanol ay samaysay oo markaa uu la socdo kuwa lagu dhuubo ee Carbomer (polymer ee acrylic aashato) oo markaa laga dhigay jeel, ama humectant sida glycerin oo dareere laga dhigay, ama xumbadu si markaa si fudud loogu isticmaali karo oo noola yareero saamaynta qalalka ee aalkolada.
en-mt: Most of them are isopropyl or ethanol-made alcohols that are then accompanied by carbomers (polymer in acrylic assayto) that are then made into gels, or humectant such as glycerin made into liquids, or foams so that they can be easily used and reduce the dry effects of alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Marka lagu daro aalada hydrogen-peroxide la milay waxa ay kordhisaa hawsha dilida cayayaanka.Nadiifiyaha gacmaha ee markaa ay ku jirto ugu yaraan 60 ilaa 95% aalkolo waxa ay ku filan tahay dilida jeermiska.
en-mt: When added to the soluble hydrogen-peroxide device it increases the process of killing insects. Hand sanitizers that then contain at least 60 to 95% alcohol are enough to kill germs.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: In alkahoosha gacmaha lagu nadiifiyo waxa uu dilaa baaktiiriyada, baakteeriyada dawadu ayna dilin (MRSA iyo VRE), qaaxada, iyo fayrusyada qaar (oo ay ku jiraan HIV, herpes, RVS, rhinovirus, vaccinai, hargabka, iyo jooniska) iyo fayruska.
en-mt: Hand-sanitized alcohol kills bacteria, drug-indefective bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RVS, rhinovirus, vaccinai, influenza, and jaundies) and viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Aalkolada gacmaha lagu jijibiyo ee nadiifiyaha ahi ee uu ku jiro 70% aalkolada waxa ay dishaa 99.97% (3.5 duwaanka yaraynta, sidoo kale 35 yaraynta tirada) baakteeriyada gacaha saaran 30 ilbidhiqsi kadib marka la mariyo iyo 99.99% ilaa 99.999% (4 ilaa 5 duwaan yarayn) bakteeriyada gacanta saaran 1 daqiiqo kadib marka la mariyo.Gacme nadiifiyaha ayaa wax wanaagsan ka tara bakteeriyada oo waxa badan kama taraan fayrasyada.
en-mt: Hand-washing alcohol that contains 70% alcohol kills 99.97% (3.5 reducing doses, also 35 reducing quantity) bacteria on the hands 30 seconds after applying and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 doses) of bacteria on the hands after 1 minute of applied. Gacme cleaners do good against bacteria and they don't help viruses much.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Gacmo nadiifiyaha alkohoosha leh badanaa waxba kama taraan norovirus (ama Norwalk) fayrusyada ah kuwaas oo ah kuwa ugu badan ee keena gestroentertis. Waa in gacmaha jeermis dile ama alkohool wanaagsan loo isticmaalaa isku xoqa inta ay qoyan yihiin ama si wanaagsan loo wada gaadhsiiyaa labada gacmood.,
en-mt: Alcoholic hand sanitizers often do nothing to help norovirus (or Norwalk) viruses which are the most common cause of gestroentertis. It is necessary to use the hands of a disinfecting or good alcoholic to rub the same while they are wet or to be properly delivered to both hands.,

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Xaga hore iyo dhabarka labada gacmood iyo inta u dhaxeyssa iyo dhamaadka dhamaan faraha ayaa la isku xoqayaa celcelis ahaan 30 ilbidhiqsi ilaa inta dareeraha, xumbada ama jeelku ay engego.
en-mt: The front and back of both hands and between and at the end of all the fingers are rubbed together for an average of 30 seconds until the liquid, bubble or jelly witheres.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Faraha caaradooda waa in sidoo kale la maydhaa, labada calaacalood la isku xoqaa. Xarunta Maraykanka ee Xakamaynta iyo Kahortaga Xanuunadu waxa ay ku talinaysaa gacmo maydhiga gacmaha dushooda lagu xoqayo gacmo nadiifiyaha, gaar ahaan marka ay gacmuhu aad u uskag yihiin.
en-mt: The tip of the fingers should also be washed, the two ankles rubbed together. The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing with hand sanitizer, especially when the hands are too dry.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Isticmaalka badan ee waxyaabahan waxa ay ku xiran tahay isticmaalkooda fudud iyo dilitaankooda wax ku oolka ah ee cayayaanka; laakiin, waa inayna noqon badalka gacmo nadiifiyaha munaadabka ah iyada oo la waayo saabuun iyo biyo mooyee.
en-mt: The overuse of these products depends on their easy use and their effective killing of insects; But, it must not be a substitute for hand sanitizers except for soap and water.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Isticmaalka joogtada ah ee gacmo nadiifiyaha alkohoosha leh waxa uu keeni karaa maqaar qalal iyada oo ay ku jiraan maqaar qooye iyo/ama emollients qaacidada.
en-mt: Regular use of alcoholic hand sanitizers can cause dry skin by containing peeling skin and/or alollients.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Saamaynta qalaylka ee alkohoosha waxaa lagu yarayn karaan ama meesha lagaga saaraa glycerin iyo/ama emollient kale oo qaadida laguu daro.
en-mt: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or removed by glycerin and/or other emollient added to your removal.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Tijaabada caafimaadka, gacmo nadiifiyaha aalkolada leh ee markaa uu ku jiro emollients keeno dhibta maqaarka ee yar iyo qalaylka marka loo eego saabuunta ama saabuunta cayayaanka disha.
en-mt: In clinical trials, an alcoholic hand sanitizer that then contains emollients that causes less skin distress and dryness than soap or insecticide soap.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Xasaasiyada taabashada dematitis, qaadida xanuunka urticaria ama kacsanaanta ee alkohoosha ama waxa la socda alkohoosha ee gacmo isku xoqa ayaan badanaa iman.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.

en-mt: The lower rate of reducing the difficulty of contacting dematitis then becomes more found than soap and watery fares.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Inkasta oo ay leeyihiin saamayn, wixii biyaha aan ahayn kama dhaqaan gacmaha wixii dabiici ah, kaliya jeermiska ayay ka dilaan.
en-mt: Although they have an effect, what is not water does not wash the hands of what is natural, they only kill germs.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Waana sababta keentay in gacmo nadiifiyuhu ayna wax u tarin sida saabuunta iyo biyaha kahortaga faafitaanka cayayaanka, maadaama uu cayayaanku saarnaan doono gacmaha.
en-mt: This is why hand sanits are not as helpful as soap and water to prevent the spread of insects, as the insects will be on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Gacmo nadiifiyaha aan alkahoosha lahayn waxa uu si wayn ugu tiirsan yahay waxa uu ka samaysan yahay iyo qaacidada, oo waxa uu weligiiba wax wayn tari jiray marka lala isticmaalo alkahoosha ee alkohoosha la isku jijibiyo.
en-mt: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer relies heavily on its composition and its ingredients, and has always been very useful when used with alcohol-free hand sanitizer.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Dhawaan, kuwa soo baxay oo loo isticmaalo benzalkonium chloride ayaa lagu arkay joogtayn iyo urur hawsha cayayaan dilida kadib arka la mariyo, si ka duwan aalkolada, taas oo markaa lagu arkay waxyar yaro marka si joogto ah loo isticmaalo, maadaama oo ay u badan tahay in maqaarku uu la qabsado.
en-mt: Recently, those exposed and used for benzalkonium chloride have been shown to be persistent and association with the task of killing insects after seeing it applied, unlike alcohol, which has then been seen slightly less when used regularly, as it is more likely that the skin will adapt.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Dad badan oo bulshada dakhligoodu hooseeyo ah ma awoodaan sabuunta oo waxa ay isticmaalaan taas badalkeed danbaska ama ciida.
en-mt: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use it instead of sand or sand.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Danbaska ama ciida ayaa biyaha kaligood dhaama, laakiin waxa ay ka waxtar yar yihiin saabuunta.
en-mt: Danba or sand drains water alone, but they are less effective than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Hal walaac oo jira ayaa ah in ciida ama danbuska inay la socdaan cayayaan taas oo markaa kordhinaysa faafitaanka xanuunka halka uu ka dhimi lahaa.
en-mt: There is one concern that the soil or danbus is accompanied by a parasite which then increases the spread of the disease while reducing it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Sida saabuunta, danbasku waxaa weeye sidoo kale nadiifiye maadaama oo marka uu biyaha la falgalo, uu sameeyo isku dar alkaline ah.
en-mt: Like soap, danbas is also a detergent as when it interacts with water, it makes an alkaline mixture.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO waxa ay ku talinaynaa in danbaska ama niista ay badali karaan sabuunta marka aan saabuun la heli karin.
en-mt: WHO recommends that danba or niista can replace soap when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Farsamada gacmo maydhiga ee saxda ah ee ay ku taliyaan Xarunta Kahortaga iyo Xakamaynta Xanuunada Maraykanka ee lagaga hortago gudbinta xanuunka waxaa kamid ah talaabooyinka soo socda:
en-mt: The correct hand washing technique recommended by the U.S. Center for Disease Prevention and Control for prevention of transmission of the disease includes the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Gacmaha waxa aad ku qoysaa biyo diiran ama biyo qabaw oo socda.
en-mt: Wash your hands with warm water or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Biyaha socda waxaa loogu taliyaa maadaama oo biya taagan ay dhici karto inay wasakhoobaan, oo heerkulka biyaha ayaan keeneynin farqi.
en-mt: Running water is recommended as standing water can be contaminated, and the water temperature does not cause a difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Maqaarka gacmaha marka si wanaagsan loogu xoqo saabuunta, oo ay ku jiraan dhabar gacmaha, faraha dushooda, iyo cidiyaha hoostooda.
en-mt: The skin of the hands when rubbed nicely with soap, including back of the hands, on the fingers, and under the nails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Saabuuntu waxa ay maqaarka ka qaadaa jeermiska, oo daraasaduhu waxa ay muujinayaan in dadku si wanaagsan u maydhaan gacmahooda marka ay isticmaalaan saabuun marka loo eego marka ay biyo kaliya isticmaalaan.
en-mt: Soap removes germs from the skin, and studies show that people wash their hands better when they use soap than when they just use water.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Waxa aad isku xoqdaa ugu yaraan 20 ilbidhiqsi.
en-mt: You rub it together for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Isku xoqidu waxa ay abuurtaa xoqitaan, taas oo markaa ka caawisa in jeermiska maqaarka laga mariyo, oo markaa isku xoqa dheeri waxa uu maqaarka ka bixiyaa jeermisyo farabadan.
en-mt: Scratching creates scratching, which then helps to remove the germs from the skin, and then scratching the skin further removes more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Hoos dhigida biyo socda.
en-mt: Lowering running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: In lagu dariyo kuwa taagan waxa ay dib u uskagayn kartaa gacmaha.
en-mt: Adding those standing can turn back the hands.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Ku qalajinta tuwaalka ama in hawadu qalajiso.
en-mt: Drying with a towel or by drying the air.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Gacmaha qoyan ama yara qoyani ayaa si fudud u wasakhoobi karaan.Meelaha ugu badan ee laga boodo waa suulka, curcurka, aaga u dhaxeeya faraha, iyo cidiyaha hoostooda.
en-mt: Wet or slightly wet hands can easily get dirty. The most common jumping points are the thumb, the wrist, the area between the fingers, and the under the nails.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Cidiyaha samayska ah iyo cidiyaha rinjiga lamariyo waxa ku hoos dhuuman kara cayayaanka.
en-mt: Artificial nails and paint can hide under insects.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: In looshin lagu qooyo ayaa badanaa lagu taliyaa si ayna gacmuhu u qalalin; maqaarka qalalan waxa uu horseedi karaa waxyeelo maqaarka ah taas oo markaa kordhinaysa khatarta in caabuqa uu gudbiyo.
en-mt: Peeling a lyce is often recommended so that the hands do not dry; dry skin can lead to skin damage which then increases the risk of infection transmission.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Waxyaabo kala duwan oo jaban ayaa la samayn karaa si markaa loo fudueeyo gacmo dhaqida marka biyaha tuubada iyo/ama sabuunta aan la heleynin, sida, in biyaha laga soo shubto jerikaan ama meelo leh daloolo wanaagsan iyo/ama isticmaalka danbaska hadii aad ku sugan tahay dalalka soo koraya.Marka lagu jiro xaalad biyo yaraan ah (sida dugsiyada ama aaga miyiyaada dalalka soo koraya), waxaa jira qaab biyaha loo kaydsan karo, sida "caagar yar oo meel lagasoo laalaadsado" iyo ikhtiyaaro kale oo jaban.
en-mt: Various inexpensive things can be done to then facilitate hand washing when tap water and/or soap is not available, such as, pumping water from rinse or places with good pores and/or using the tail if you are in developing countries. In a water shortage situation (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there is a way to store water, such as "small plastic hanging from somewhere" and other cheaper options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Caagar yar oo meel lagasoo laalaadsadaa waxaa weeye teknooloojiyad fudud oo loo isticmaali karo caaga laga soo laalaadiyay xadhid, oo markaa lasoo janjeedhiyay si markaa biyo yar uu usoo saari karo si gacmaha loogu maydho iyo sabuun.
en-mt: A small bottle hanging from a place is a simple technology that can be used for plastic hanging from a bandage, and then tilted so that it can produce a little water to wash hands and soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Gacmaha in si wanaagsan loo qalajiyo ayaa qayb muhiim ah ka ah nidaamka nadiifinta, laakiin waxa uu muran ka taagan yahay waxtarta gacmo qalajinta meelaha dadku wadaagaan.
en-mt: Hand drying properly is an important part of the cleaning system, but it is controversial about the effectiveness of drying hands in publicly shared areas.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Daraasado badan ayaa muujinaya in tuwaalkau aad uga nadaafad badan ayahay marka loo eego qalajiyaha gacmaha ee laydhka ah ee ku yaal suuliyo badan.
en-mt: Many studies show that a towel is much cleaner than a light hand dryer on many toes.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Sanadkii 2008, daraasad ayaa waxaa sameysay Jaamacada Westminster, London, waxaana kafaalo qaaday warshadaha tuwaalka waraaqaha ee European Tissue Symposium, in la isbarbar dhigo heerarka nadaafadda ee ay bixiyaan tuwaalada waraaqaha, qalajiyeyaasha hawada-diirran iyo kuwa qalajiyeyaasha diyaaradda-hawada oo casri ah.
en-mt: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and was sponsored by the paper towel industry at the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the hygiene standards offered by paper towels, air-warm dryers and state-of-the-art aircraft-air dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Kadib marka la dhaqo gacmaha oo lagu qalajiyo hawada diiran, tirada bakteeriyada ee laga heley waxa ay korodhay faraha 194% iyo calaacashane 254%.
en-mt: After washing hands and drying them with warm air, the number of bacteria found in them increased by 194% and 254% of the fingers.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: In lagu qalajistaa hawada diyaaradu wax aay kordhisay celelis ahaan wadarta tirada baakteeriyada faraha 42% iyo baabacooyinka 15%.
en-mt: To dry the air of the aircraft increased the total number of fingerprints by 42% and 15% to 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Kadib marka la dhaqo oo lagu qalajiyo gacmaha tawalad, bakteeriyada waxa ay hoos uga dhacdaa faraha ilaa 76% iyo calaacashane ilaa 77%.Saynisyahanada ayaa sidoo kale sameeyeen shaybaaro lagu ogaanayo hadii ay jiraan oo ay iman karaan isku gudbin meelaha kale ee gacmaha lagu dhaqo iyo deegaanka lagu dhaqo taas oo markaa ka timaado qaabka qalajinta.
en-mt: After washing and drying the hands with a tuck, the bacteria decrease from the fingers to 76% and the gums to 77%. Scientists have also set up laboratories to determine if there is and can come about transmission in other handwashing areas and the environment that is then coming from the drying pattern.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Qalajiyaha hawada diyaarada, kaas oo markaa meel kasoo saarata hawada ku socota xawaare 180 m/ilbiriqsigii (650km/saacadii; 400mph), waxa uu awood u yeeshay inuu buufiyo cayayaanka gacmaha saaran oo waxa uu wasakheeyay meesha iyo dadkale ee meesha isticmaalaya iyo deegaanka lagu dhaqanaayo kuwaas oo ilaa 2 mitir isu jira.
en-mt: The aircraft's air dryer, which then removes the air at a speed of 180 m/second (650km/h; 400mph), has been able to spray insects on its hands and has polluted the area and other people using it and the area where it is being practiced which are up to 2 meters apart.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Isticmaalka hawada diiran qalajiyaha ah waxa uu faafiyaa cayayaanka ila 0.25 mitir in u jirta qalajiyaha.
en-mt: Using a warm air dryer it spreads insects up to 0.25 meters from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.

en-mt: Alcohol-rich hand sanitizer which contains alcohol is 60%.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Farxalka caafimaadka ah ayaa la waajibiyay kadib markii uu dhakhtarka reer Hangari Ignaz Semmelweis uu arkay faa'idadeeda (1846) ee kahortaga xanuunada deegaanka isbitaalka.
en-mt: Medical hand washing was obliged after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis saw its benefits (1846) in preventing disease in the hospital environment.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Waxaa jira aalado elektoroonig ah oo markaa xasuusiya shaqaalaha isbitaalka inay maydhaan gacmahooda marka ay iloobaan.
en-mt: There are electronic devices that then remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Hal daraasad ayaa lagu ogaaday heerarka caabuqa hoos udhaca isticmaalkooda.
en-mt: One study found infection rates decreased in their use.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Gacma dhaqa caafimaadka waa ugu yaraan 15 ilbiriqsi, iyada oo la isticmaalayo xaddi badan oo saabuun iyo biyo ah ama jel si aad u masaxdo oo u xoqdo qayb kasta oo ka mid ah gacmaha.
en-mt: A medical hand wash is at least 15 seconds, using a large amount of soap and water or a jel to rub and scrub any part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Gacmaha waa in la isku jijibiyaa iyada oo la is dhax gelinayo.
en-mt: Hands should be classed together by intersting.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Hadii qashin ku hoos jiro cidiyaha, burush ayaa loo isticmaali karaa si looga saaro.
en-mt: If there is debris under the nail, a brush can be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Maadaama oo jeermisku uu kusii jirayo biyaha gacmaha ku jira, waxaa muhiim ah in si wanaagsan loogu radiyo oo markaa lagu qalajiyo tuwaal nadiif ah.
en-mt: Since the germs are present in the water in the hands, it is important to properly radio and then dry with a clean towel.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).

en-mt: After drying, the toy can be used to plug the water (and to open the exit door if it becomes cloudy).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Waxa aad iska ilaalisaa in gacmahaaga aad dib uga qaadaan uskaga meelahaas.
en-mt: Be careful not to take back your hands from these places.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Sababta gacmaha loo dhaqayo habdhismeedka daryeelka caafimaadka waa in meesha laga saaro uskaga cayayaanka ("jeermiska") lagana fogaado gudbinta.
en-mt: The reason for washing hands in the health care ecosystem is to remove the pesticides ("germs" and avoid transmission.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Wargesyka New England ee Caafimaadka ayaa laga qoray in faraxal la'aanta aan laga ogolayn badanaa meelaha caafimaadka, taas oo tiro badan oo dhakhtaro iyo kaaliyayaal caafimaad ahi ay iloobaan inay si joogto ah u dhaqaan gacmahooda kahor inta ayna taaban bukaanka, markaa ay gudbiyaan cayayaanada.
en-mt: The New England Health Department reported that non-fertility is not allowed in most medical settings, in which a large number of doctors and medical assistants forget to wash their hands regularly before touching patients, in which case they transmit the bugs.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Daraasad ayaa muujinaysa in gacmo maydhiga munaasabka ah iyo nidaamyada kale ee fudud ay yareeyaan xadiga caabuqa dhiiga ee kaadida u mara boqokiiba 66. Hay'ada Caafimaadka Adduunku waxa ay baahisay in waraaqo ay ku qoran yahay heerka gacmo maydhiga iyo gacmo isku xoqa ee waaxda daryeelka caafimaad.
en-mt: A study shows that proper hand washing and other simple systems reduce the amount of blood infections that pass through the urine by 66 percent. The World Health Organization has announced that papers list the standard for hand washing and hand-rubbing in the health care sector.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.

en-mt: Tools sold can measure and ensure hand hygiene, if it is necessary to introduce compliance to the requirements.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Hay'ada Caafimaadka Adduunka waxa ay leedahay "Shan Wakhti" oo gacmaha la maydho:

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: kadib marka bukaanka loo adeego.Sidoo kale kiimikada saabuunta disha jeermiska ("saabuunta dawo lagu daray" ama "cayayaanka laysa") ficilka dilida cayayaanka marka gacmaha lagu dhaqo.
en-mt: after the patient is served. Also the chemical soap that kills germs ("medicine-added soap" or "insecticide") the action of killing insects when washing hands.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Ficilka noocaas ah ee dilidu waxaa loo baahan karaan kahor inta aan la samaynin qaliin ama meesha aadka looga dilo cayaayaan caabuqa keena.Waa in lagu xoqaa 'halka' gacan ee wax lagu qalayo, hadii loo baahdo in tuubada iyada oo aan la taaban is furi karta oo isna xiri karta, xoogaa chlorheidine ama iodine ayaa lagu dhaqi, towaal nadiif ah si loogu qalajiyo gacmaha kadib dhaqida, iyo burush nadiif ah oo lagu xoqo iyo agab kale oo la nadiifiyay oo lagu nadiiyo cidiyaha hoostooda.
en-mt: Such an act of killing may be necessary before performing surgery or where it is most commonly killed. It should be rubbed with 'where' the hand is being used for slaughtering, if necessary the tube can open without touching and close itself, slightly chlorheidine or iodine is washed, a clean sewer to dry the hands after washing, and a clean brush to scratch and other cleaned materials to wash under the nails.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Dhamaan waxa la isku qurxiyo waa in la iska saaraa.
